description: Sustaining, repairing, and optimizing biological bodies and immediate personal functions for self/others. Peer to all; covers maintenance, healing, hygiene across lifecycle. Includes: nursing, feeding, grooming, reproduction, deathcare. Excludes: habitat logistics (Domestic Operations), skill-building (Developmental Formation). Examples: Breastfeeding, surgery recovery, hygiene rituals, elder bathing, psychedelic therapy. Tie-break: Direct body intervention primary (vs. environment or cognition).

Logistical management of household habitats, routines, and continuity; structural peer to physics. Includes: cleaning, scheduling, provisioning, family admin. Excludes: body-direct care (Somatic), market trade (Value Circulation). Examples: Laundry cycles, meal planning, home budgeting, errand coordination, bedtime routines. Tie-break: Habitat/system flow primary (vs. biology or commerce).

Transforming matter/energy into tools, structures, goods; artisanal to industrial. Includes: farming, building, manufacturing, illicit synth. Excludes: exchange (Value Circulation), pure design (Epistemic Inquiry). Examples: Crop farming, welding builds, drug labs, software assembly, textile weaving. Tie-break: Substrate manipulation for utility (vs. trade or theory).

Transactions, arbitrage, resource flows; formal/illicit markets as civilization engine. Includes: trade, finance, hustling, scams. Excludes: production (Material), force-seizure (Adversarial Force). Examples: Stock trades, drug distribution, bartering, laundering, gig deals. Tie-break: Value transfer/negotiation primary.

Force, threat, defense to dominate/seize/protect; violence engine, state/non-state. Includes: war, crime, policing, cyber ops. Excludes: rules (Governance), persuasion (Mimetic Engineering). Examples: Combat ops, robbery, espionage, gang enforcement, self-defense. Tie-break: Kinetic/physical threat central.

Rule-making, hierarchies, collective coordination; bureaucracy to tribes. Includes: laws, management, diplomacy. Excludes: force (Adversarial), exchange (Value). Examples: Legislation, corporate boards, unions, courts, community councils. Tie-break: Norm/rule administration primary.

Mind/behavior alteration via symbols/relations sans force; persuasion engine. Includes: marketing, propaganda, seduction. Excludes: transcendence (Metaphysical), body force (Adversarial). Examples: Ads, psyops, cons, courtship, activism. Tie-break: Non-kinetic change primary.

Truth-seeking, modeling, verification; formal/informal sensemaking. Includes: science, intel, auditing. Excludes: transmission (Developmental), application (domain-specific). Examples: Experiments, gossip nets, data models, history, forecasts. Tie-break: Accumulation/verification itself primary.

Systematic capability installation in others over time; parenting to training. Includes: education, rites, coaching. Excludes: one-off change (Mimetic), inquiry (Epistemic). Examples: Childrearing, apprenticeships, boot camps, mentorship. Tie-break: Transformative process primary.

Bond formation/maintenance/dissolution; belonging webs. Includes: friendship, kinship, gossip. Excludes: instrumental change (Mimetic), rules (Governance). Examples: Dating, family ties, gossip circles, community events. Tie-break: Relation itself primary.

Autotelic play, beauty, challenge; voluntary thrill. Includes: sports, arts, hobbies. Excludes: profit mgmt (Value), ritual (Metaphysical). Examples: Gaming, athletics, graffiti, festivals. Tie-break: Intrinsic engagement primary.

Transcendent meaning, rituals, ethics; sacred/ultimate. Includes: prayer, philosophy, occult. Excludes: clinical (Somatic), secular play (Ludic). Examples: Liturgy, meditation, funerals, ethics debates. Tie-break: Non-empirical concern primary.
